content: Moltbook's distribution strategy involves immediately installing a HEARTBEAT.md file that leverages OpenClaw's built-in heartbeating feature to power agents filling Moltbook.

To install Moltbook, users send their agent a message with a link to `https://www.moltbook.com/skill.md`, which contains installation instructions including curl commands to set up skill, heartbeat, messaging, and package files locally.
Cursor's approach to self-driving codebases involves a central Planner agent that commands workers and can spin up other planners to achieve high throughput, such as ~1000 commits per hour.
OpenAI Frontier centralizes the management layer for large numbers of high-volume agents within a dashboard that allows drilling down to individual agent instances.
The only two ways to make money in software are by bundling it and unbundling it.
A massive AI-enabled bundling of all software is currently occurring, likely at a larger magnitude than the hardware bundling seen with smartphones.
Attempts to build SuperApps have consistently failed outside of China.
ChatGPT and Claude Cowork are on their way to becoming AI "Superapps".
Eventually, apps will share tokens to avoid users paying for many $20/month subscriptions, though this is not expected soon according to Sam Altman.
